I believe this is already possible -- ScipyOptimizerInterface takes an optional parameter optimizer_kwargs, into which you can pass things like {'bounds': [[0, 1]]} etc.

The deficiency, as I see it, is that you don't directly control how the Variables you are optimizing over get packed into a single vector for SciPy to do its thing with... LMK if this is a problem/if you have any ideas on how to improve this.

body:
I believe this is already possible -- `ScipyOptimizerInterface` takes an optional parameter `optimizer_kwargs`, into which you can pass things like `{'bounds': [[0, 1]]}` etc.

The deficiency, as I see it, is that you don't directly control how the `Variable`s you are optimizing over get packed into a single vector for SciPy to do its thing with... LMK if this is a problem/if you have any ideas on how to improve this.
